document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of Tridentella Richardson, 1905 (Isopoda: Cymothoida: Tridentellidae) from New Caledonia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of Tridentella Richardson, 1905 (Isopoda: Cymothoida: Tridentellidae) from New Caledonia

paragraph.materialsCitation:
T. acheronae Bruce, 1988
; New Zealand ;
424–1006 m
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
T. cornuta Kussakin, 1979
; northwestern Pacific;
907– 935 m
. Male with three head spines, pereonite 1 with three anterior median spines; pleotelson rounded, with low radiating ridges; female with pleotelson as for male, but no head spines.

T. glutacantha Delaney & Brusca, 1985
; California ; it is possible that two species are included under this namethe male pleotelson is not marginally serrate whereas the female allotype has prominent marginal serrations, this being a character usually present in both sexes ( Bruce 2002 ), the female antennula and antenna is longer than that of the holotype and the uropodal endopod shape appears to differ between the holotype and allotype ;
128– 360 m
.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
T. katlae
sp. nov.
New Caledonia ; pleotelson lateral margins serrate;
150–200 m
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
T. namibia Brandt & Poore, 2001
; off Orange River, Namibia ; 175–351 m ; acute short spines all over, pleotelson rounded, spines forming weakly radiating rows, eyes large, head with some low nodules.

T. ornamenta ( Menzies & George, 1972 )
; Peru–
Chile trench;
907–935 m
.

T. ornata ( Richardson, 1911 )
; Atlantic coast of USA , shallow;
T. williamsi Delaney, 1990
is a junior synonym (
Kensley and Heard , 1997
); large eyes; pleotelson lateral margins strongly serrate; shallow to
168 m .

T. quinicornis Delaney & Brusca, 1985
; California ; 53 m ; weakly ornamented, head with four dorsal nodules (not 5, the fifth perhaps refers to the rostrum).

paragraph.materialsCitation:
T. rosemariae Bruce, 2002
; New Zealand ;
550–1840 m
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
T. sculpturata Kussakin, 1955
, northwestern Pacific; small ( 6–12 mm ); male with posterior margins ornamented, pleotelson with 5 longitudinal ridges;
70– 96 m
.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
T. brandtae Bruce, 2008
; Banda Sea , Indonesia ; very finely nodular, appearing plain;
425 m
.

T. tangeroae Bruce, 1988
; New Zealand ;
90–94 m
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
T. benguela Brandt & Poore, 2001
; off Orange River, Namibia; not ornamented, figured with weakly radiating ridges; possibly juvenile of
T. namibia
; 285 m .

paragraph.materialsCitation:
T. japonica Thielemann, 1910
; Japan ; c.
600 m
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
T. laevicephalax Menzies, 1962
; shallow, not ornamented ( Carvacho 1977 ); Chile.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
T. magna
sp. nov.
New Caledonia ; large ( 36 mm ), head with three small tubercles, otherwise smooth;
760 m
.

T. memikat Bruce, 2008
; Kei Is. , Indonesia ;
620–809 m
.

T. palmata
sp. nov.
New Caledonia ,
260–390 m
.

T. recava Bowman, 1986
; off
New York
; smooth, characterised by a deeply excavate pleotelson apex;
180–304 m
.

T. tanimbar Bruce, 2008
; Banda Sea , Indonesia ;
410 m
.
